conclusion: Two cars, A and B, are traveling in the same direction on a straight road with their velocities over time plotted on a v-t graph.

The x-axis is time in seconds, and the y-axis is velocity in meters per second. Car A has a horizontal line at 40 m/s, and Car B has a straight line starting at the origin reaching 40 m/s at around 20 seconds.
Understanding a v-t graph: the area under the curve represents the displacement of the object over that time period.
Both cars are side by side at t = 30 s, meaning their positions are the same at that time.
Need to determine if car A is ahead or behind car B at t = 10 s.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t = 10 s onwards, starting at t = 0 s with zero velocity and accelerating to 40 m/s in 10 seconds.
Car B starts at t = 0 s with zero velocity and has a straight line passing through t = 20 s and v = 40 m/s, indicating constant acceleration.
Car A's graph shows a horizontal line at 40 m/s starting from t = 10 s.
Car B has a constant acceleration of 2 m/sÂ², calculated from the slope of the v-t graph.
Find the displacement of each car up to t = 10 s and t = 30 s.
Car A's displacement from t = 0 to t = 10 s is 200 m, calculated as the area under the v-t graph (triangle).
Car A's displacement from t = 10 s to t = 30 s is 800 m, calculated as 40 m/s * 20 s.
Total displacement of Car A from t = 0 to t = 30 s is 1000 m.
Car B's velocity at t = 30 s is 60 m/s, calculated as v_B = a_B * t.
Car B's displacement from t = 0 to t = 30 s is 900 m, calculated as the area under the v-t graph (triangle).
